subject: Psychology
title: Identity-Based Habits
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Identity-Based Habits.

hook.text: Don't say 'I'm trying to quit smoking.' Say 'I'm not a smoker.' The identity shift changes everything.

buildup.text: James Clear argues that lasting change comes from shifting your identity, not just your behavior.

discovery.text: Each time you act on the habit, you cast a vote for the new identity. Enough votes and the belief shifts.

twist.text: Most people set outcome goals (lose 10 pounds). Identity goals (become a healthy person) change far more behavior.

climax.text: You don't rise to your goals. You fall to your identity. Build the identity and the habits follow.

punchline.text: Decide who you want to be. Then prove it with small actions.

quiz.question: What does identity-based habit change focus on?
options: Shifting who you believe you are rather than what you do
Setting bigger and harder goals each month
